snippet: Joshua Wong, a 17-year-old student, has been at the center of the democracy movement as young activists represent a troubling confirmation for officials that their generation is the one most alienated from Beijing.
abstract: Joshua Wong, 17-year-old student activist at the center of democracy movement in Hong Kong, is among young activists who represent a troubling confirmation for officials that their generation is the most alienated from Beijing; Communist supervisors, as well as the local government, are infuriated over Wong's prominence in the protest movement.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ALAN WONG

lead_paragraph: Joshua Wong, a 17-year-old student, has been at the center of the democracy movement as young activists represent a troubling confirmation for officials that their generation is the one most alienated from Beijing.

headline.main: At 17, Setting Off Protests That Roil Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: At 17, Setting Off Protests That Roil Hong Kong
